meanings.definition: A fixed share or amount of something that a person or group is entitled to receive or expected to contribute.
meanings.sent1: Each student has a quota of snacks they can bring to school.
meanings.sent2: The company set a quota for the number of products each employee must sell.
meanings.sent3: The race to eat the most hot dogs became a competition of who could reach their quota first.
meanings.sent4: Her quota of patience was quickly running out as the children continued to misbehave.
meanings.sent5: The daily quota of water intake is essential for staying healthy.

meanings.definition: A limit on the number of people or things that are allowed.
meanings.sent1: The fishing quota for the lake ensures the fish population remains stable.
meanings.sent2: There is a quota on the number of attendees allowed at the event.
meanings.sent3: The quota on candy consumption at the party led to disappointed faces.
meanings.sent4: The quota on library books borrowed per person prevents hoarding.
meanings.sent5: Exceeding the daily quota of screen time can strain your eyes.
